intro: Pyrethrum eginense, commonly known as the Eginian pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant is known for its production of pyrethrins, natural insecticides used in organic pest control. Pyrethrum eginense typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its ornamental value and ecological benefits make it a valuable addition to gardens and natural habitats.
